H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H183.def: = state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's {L:נֶפֶשׁ<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>} ≈ and can be both good and evil

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H5273.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H2154.def: = a project or scheme as conceived in the heart or mind, which can be either bad or good

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H2027.def: = the killing of people in a cruel and violent way

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H8505.def: = action by which humans or deities determine the weight or size of an object

H3826.def: literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H5317.def: = virgin {L:honey<SDBH:דְּבַשׁ>}, dripping straight from the honeycomb; ≈ regarded as very desirable food of high quality

H4966.def: = state in which food tastes well

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6895.def: = causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H5276.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H5228.def: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H6257.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which humans perform all events that are necessary or required

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7063.def: = thorny plant ► considered to be a weed; ≈ associated with neglect and desolation

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2738.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = plant with thorns or another desert shrub, like nettle (|iUrtica dioica|i* or |iUrtica pilulifera|i*); ► useless; ≈ symbol of uncultivated areas

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H1444.def: = a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H2040.def: = state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H8572.def: = state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive

H2264.def: = action by which humans fold their hands together, ► probably in order to rest or take a nap; ≈ associated with being idle and laziness

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H7389.def: = state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4270.def: = state in which objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God
